DOC.brief_summary: RATIONALE : Interleukin-12 may kill tumor cell stop blood flow tumor stimulate person 's white blood cell kill cancer cell . PURPOSE : Phase I trial study effectiveness interleukin-12 treating patient hematologic cancer solid tumor .
DOC.brief_title: Interleukin-12 Treating Patients With Hematologic Cancers Solid Tumors
DOC.detailed_description: OBJECTIVES : I. Assess safety maximum tolerate dose interleukin-12 ( IL-12 ) patient hematologic malignancy solid tumor undergone high-dose chemotherapy autologous stem cell transplantation . II . Evaluate hematologic immunologic effect IL-12 patient . OUTLINE : This dose-escalation study . Patients receive interleukin-12 ( IL-12 ) IV single test dose follow 2 week rest . Patients receive IL-12 IV daily 5 day follow 16 day rest 6 course . Cohorts 3-5 patient receive escalate dos IL-12 maximum tolerate dose ( MTD ) determine . The MTD define dose precede 2 5 patient experience dose-limiting toxicity . Patients follow death . PROJECTED ACCRUAL : A total 12 patient accrue study .
DOC.criteria: DISEASE CHARACTERISTICS : Histologically prove hematologic malignancy solid tumor Undergone highdose chemotherapy chemoradiotherapy autologous bone marrow and/or peripheral blood stem cell transplantation Confirmation complete remission require acute leukemia No significant CNS disease No clinically significant ascites pleural effusion Hormone receptor status : Not specify PATIENT CHARACTERISTICS : Age : 18 Sex : Not specify Menopausal status : Not specify Performance status : ECOG 01 Life expectancy : Not specify Hematopoietic : Absolute neutrophil count least 1,000/mm3 Hemoglobin least 9 g/dL ( transfusion allow ) Platelet count least 50,000/mm3 ( transfusion independent ) No clinically significant coagulopathy ( unless due cancer resolve ) Hepatic : Bilirubin great 2 mg/dL SGOT great 2 time upper limit normal No chronic acute hepatitis Hepatitis B surface antigen negative Renal : Creatinine great 2 mg/dL No symptomatic hypercalcemia Calcium le 12 mg/dL Cardiovascular : No uncontrolled angina No arrhythmias require drug device therapy No symptomatic congestive heart failure Pulmonary : No clinically significant pulmonary dysfunction Metabolic : No uncontrolled diabetes mellitus No untreated hyper hypothyroidism No Cushing 's disease Gastrointestinal : No clinically significant gastrointestinal hemorrhage No uncontrolled peptic ulcer disease No history inflammatory bowel disease Other : Not pregnant nursing Negative pregnancy test Fertile patient must use effective contraception No serious infection require IV antibiotic No psychosis No clinically significant autoimmune disease HIV negative PRIOR CONCURRENT THERAPY : Biologic therapy : See Disease Characteristics No concurrent biologic therapy Chemotherapy : See Disease Characteristics Endocrine therapy : At least 3 week since prior corticosteroid No concurrent systemic corticosteroid ( replacement dos ) Radiotherapy : See Disease Characteristics Surgery : Not specify Other : No concurrent investigational agent
